definition: amusing speech or act/jokes/antics/funny/amusing/Taiwan pr. [xue1 tou2]
loud laughter
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Now Kunqu troupes are trying to grab attention with provocative shows.
sentences.chinese: 现在各昆曲剧团试图演出有噱头的剧目来争取关注。

sentences.english: He's the poster boy for a growing cabal of TV anti-heroes.
sentences.chinese: 他只是反英雄剧集的密谋增长的一个噱头。

sentences.english: He didn’t favor trends or gimmicks. He liked people his own age.
sentences.chinese: 他不喜欢流行与噱头，他喜欢人们遵从自己的年纪。

sentences.english: I believe the whole thing of foreign torchbearers is just for show.
sentences.chinese: 我认为搞个老外火炬手实在是为了噱头。

sentences.english: The idea of laugh uproariously as speculation.
sentences.chinese: 这样的想法作为炒作的噱头。

sentences.english: You didn't realize it was going to be a great PR stunt?
sentences.chinese: 你没有意识到这会是一个很棒的公关噱头？

sentences.english: The Silicon Valley visits seemed like a stunt, but they were prophetic.
sentences.chinese: 硅谷来访似乎像一个噱头，但其却是预见性的。

sentences.english: Collect golden carrots and turn them into download gimmicks on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 收集黄金的利诱，使他们成为下载噱头在互联网上。

sentences.english: Dreams, of course, are a fertile subject for moviemakers.
sentences.chinese: 而梦境，当然只是电影惯用的一个噱头。

sentences.english: I realised ideal beauty is a racket.
sentences.chinese: 我意识到，理想的美是一种噱头。

sentences.english: Or was the panda donation a gimmick?
sentences.chinese: 这次的熊猫捐赠是否只是噱头呢？

sentences.english: Shanghai's City God Temple is just a decoration, a stunt.
sentences.chinese: 上海的城隍庙不过是一个摆设，一个噱头。

definition: sensationalism/vulgar claptrap to please the crowds/playing to the gallery/demagogy
to disseminate/to give publicity to/propaganda/CL:個|个[ge4]
to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
to hype/to promote (in the media)
to show off (loanword, from English "show")/to grandstand/to perform in a stage show
marketing
"sensational headline writers", people who write misleading titles in order to generate clicks from Internet users/clickbait
advertising/publicity/promotion
to flaunt/to advertise/to parade/boost/excessive praise
to advertise/a commercial/advertisement/CL:項|项[xiang4]
sensational effect/wild reaction
temperature/heat/short-lived enthusiasm
different broth but the same old medicine (idiom); a change in name only/a change in form but not in substance
old wine in a new bottle (idiom)
to bend the rules/to skirt around the issue
(neologism c. 2014) celebrity with a huge, devoted fan base/celebrity with a huge following on social media
